story.text: (Corrects day in first sentence)NEW YORK Jan 2 (Reuters) - U.S. home builder Lennar Corp. (LEN.N) and LNR Property Corp. said on Tuesday they would bring MW Housing Partners into their LandSource strategic joint venture, for which they will get about $660 million each. Lennar said it would see about $500 million in profit from the transaction, of which about $125 million will be recognized at closing and about $375 million will be deferred over future years. MW Housing will get a 62 percent financial interest in LandSource, and will have 50 percent voting control of the entity. LandSource assets are valued at about proximately $2.6 billion, with a potential increase adjustment to that value of over $600 million.
story.title: refile - mw housing buys into lennar , lnr venture
